Articles.Content: I am wanting to get this program but my computer (HP Stream 14 cbOxx) has a very small hard drive and it is nearly full.  Can Kerbal be installed and run from 32 gig SD Card in the installed Card Reader?

Yes, the game can be run from an SD card.

That said, I would be amazed if your computer would be able to run the game.  With a 1.1 Ghz Celeron Processor and only 4GB or RAM, if the game runs at all, it's going to be virtually unplayable.  Especially if your built in SSD is almost out of space, you have no headroom at all for paging.  You're likely to hit RAM limits very quickly and the game will crash.  The game really needs high clock speed, high IPC processors, which your processor is neither.

I would just hate for you to buy the game and find out that your machine is holding you back.  This kind of work isn't what laptops of that type were meant for.
